column4: I'd like to know this too: anyone know how to globally change permissions on a folder and al subsequent folders and files under that folder?
Yes. Recursive chmod, but i forget.
thanks. Good enough I'll figure out the rest
It did, it just pmed me it.
You can use Serpentine for audio or GNOMEBaker for anything else
that's exactly what I do. Sometimes Gbaker is better even for audio
Or there is the command-line tool called cdrecord
never tried that. I was just curious if Nero is worth breaking my no-non-free-soft rule...
Hell, if you have mp3 decoders, you are breaking the non-free software rule ;-)
I know... I try to use ogg whenever I can.
